FuncDef:
The dfs-group command creates a Dynamic Fabric Service (DFS) group.
The undo dfs-group command deletes a DFS group. The dfs-group command creates a Dynamic Fabric Service (DFS) group. The undo dfs-group command deletes a DFS group. By default, no DFS group is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a DFS group.
The value is 1.

ExtraInfo: A DFS group is used for device pairing. Before configuring M-LAG on a dual-active network, you must run the dfs-group command to create a DFS group.
